trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="Use the Linux Diagnostic Extension to monitor the Linux VM’s performance and diagnostic data | Microsoft Azure" description="Learn how to use the Linux Diagnostic Extension to monitor the Linux VM’s performance and diagnostic data." services="virtual-machines" documentationCenter="" authors="NingKuang" manager="timlt" editor="" tags=""/>
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="Use the Linux Diagnostic Extension to monitor the Linux VM’s performance and diagnostic data | Microsoft Azure" description="Learn how to use the Linux Diagnostic Extension to monitor the Linux VM’s performance and diagnostic data." services="virtual-machines" documentationCenter="" authors="NingKuang" manager="timlt" editor="" tags=""/>

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="virtual-machines" ms.workload="infrastructure-services" ms.tgt_pltfrm="vm-linux" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="07/20/2015" ms.author="Ning"/>
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="virtual-machines" ms.workload="infrastructure-services" ms.tgt_pltfrm="vm-linux" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="07/20/2015" ms.author="Ning"/>

trans-unit.source: The Linux Diagnostic Extension helps a user monitor the Linux VMs running on Microsoft Azure, with the following functionalities:
trans-unit.target: The Linux Diagnostic Extension helps a user monitor the Linux VMs running on Microsoft Azure, with the following functionalities:

trans-unit.source: Collects and uploads Linux VM's system performance, diagnostic, and syslog data to user’s storage table.
trans-unit.target: Collects and uploads Linux VM's system performance, diagnostic, and syslog data to user’s storage table.

trans-unit.source: Enables user to customize the data metrics that will be collected and uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Enables user to customize the data metrics that will be collected and uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Enables user to upload specified log files to designated storage table.
trans-unit.target: Enables user to upload specified log files to designated storage table.

trans-unit.source: For version 2.0, the data includes:
trans-unit.target: For version 2.0, the data includes:

trans-unit.source: All Linux Rsyslog loggings, including system, security, and application logs.
trans-unit.target: All Linux Rsyslog loggings, including system, security, and application logs.

trans-unit.source: All system data specified in this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: All system data specified in this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: User specified log files.
trans-unit.target: User specified log files.

trans-unit.source: The extension can be enabled through the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>, Azure PowerShell, or Azure CLI scripts.
trans-unit.target: The extension can be enabled through the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>, Azure PowerShell, or Azure CLI scripts.

trans-unit.source: To view and configure the system and performance data directly from the Azure portal, follow these <linkText>steps</linkText><title>URL to the Windows blog</title>.
trans-unit.target: To view and configure the system and performance data directly from the Azure portal, follow these <linkText>steps</linkText><title>URL to the Windows blog</title>.

trans-unit.source: This article focuses on enabling and configuring the extension through Azure CLI commands.This allows you to read and view the data from the storage table directly.
trans-unit.target: This article focuses on enabling and configuring the extension through Azure CLI commands.This allows you to read and view the data from the storage table directly.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Linux Agent version 2.0.6 or later.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Linux Agent version 2.0.6 or later.

trans-unit.source: Note that most Azure VM Linux gallery images include version 2.0.6 or later.
trans-unit.target: Note that most Azure VM Linux gallery images include version 2.0.6 or later.

trans-unit.source: You can run WAAgent -version to confirm the version installed in the VM.
trans-unit.target: You can run WAAgent -version to confirm the version installed in the VM.

trans-unit.source: If the VM is running a version earlier than 2.0.6 you can follow these <linkText>instructions</linkText><title>instructions</title> to update it.
trans-unit.target: If the VM is running a version earlier than 2.0.6 you can follow these <linkText>instructions</linkText><title>instructions</title> to update it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Follow <linkText>this guidance</linkText><title></title> to set up the Azure CLI environment on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Follow <linkText>this guidance</linkText><title></title> to set up the Azure CLI environment on your machine.

trans-unit.source: After the Azure CLI is installed, you can use the azure command from your command-line interface (Bash, Terminal, command prompt) to access the Azure CLI commands.
trans-unit.target: After the Azure CLI is installed, you can use the azure command from your command-line interface (Bash, Terminal, command prompt) to access the Azure CLI commands.

trans-unit.source: For example, run azure vm extension set --help for detailed usage, run azure login to log in to Azure, run azure vm list to list all the virtual machines you have on Azure.
trans-unit.target: For example, run azure vm extension set --help for detailed usage, run azure login to log in to Azure, run azure vm list to list all the virtual machines you have on Azure.

trans-unit.source: A storage account to store the data.
trans-unit.target: A storage account to store the data.

trans-unit.source: You will need a previously created storage account name and access key to upload the data to your storage.
trans-unit.target: You will need a previously created storage account name and access key to upload the data to your storage.

trans-unit.source: For version 2.0 or later, the default data that will be collected includes:
trans-unit.target: For version 2.0 or later, the default data that will be collected includes:

trans-unit.source: All Rsyslog information (including system, security, and application logs).
trans-unit.target: All Rsyslog information (including system, security, and application logs).

trans-unit.source: A core set of basis system data, note the full data set is described in this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A core set of basis system data, note the full data set is described in this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable extra data, continue with steps in scenario 2 and 3.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable extra data, continue with steps in scenario 2 and 3.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.
trans-unit.target: Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.

trans-unit.source: Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.
trans-unit.target: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to customize the performance and diagnostic data table.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to customize the performance and diagnostic data table.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.
trans-unit.target: Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the content that appears in the next example.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the content that appears in the next example.

trans-unit.source: Specify the particular data you want to collect.
trans-unit.target: Specify the particular data you want to collect.

trans-unit.source: For all supported providers and variables, reference this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For all supported providers and variables, reference this <linkText>document</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can have multiple queries and store them in multiple tables by appending more queries to the script.
trans-unit.target: You can have multiple queries and store them in multiple tables by appending more queries to the script.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Rsyslog data is always collected.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Rsyslog data is always collected.

trans-unit.source: Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.
trans-unit.target: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to collect and upload particular log files to your storage account.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to collect and upload particular log files to your storage account.

trans-unit.source: You need to specify the path to your log file, and specify the table name to store your log.
trans-unit.target: You need to specify the path to your log file, and specify the table name to store your log.

trans-unit.source: You can have multiple log files by adding multiple file/table entries to the script.
trans-unit.target: You can have multiple log files by adding multiple file/table entries to the script.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.
trans-unit.target: Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.

trans-unit.source: Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.
trans-unit.target: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.

trans-unit.source: Step 1.
trans-unit.target: Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named PrivateConfig.json with the following content.

trans-unit.source: Step 2.
trans-unit.target: Step 2.

trans-unit.source: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.
trans-unit.target: Run azure vm extension set vm_name LinuxDiagnostic Microsoft.OSTCExtensions 2.* --private-config-path PrivateConfig.json.

trans-unit.source: The performance and diagnostic data are stored in an Azure Storage table.
trans-unit.target: The performance and diagnostic data are stored in an Azure Storage table.

trans-unit.source: Review <linkText>this article</linkText><title></title> to learn how to access the data in the storage table using Azure CLI scripts.
trans-unit.target: Review <linkText>this article</linkText><title></title> to learn how to access the data in the storage table using Azure CLI scripts.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can use following UI tools to access the data:
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can use following UI tools to access the data:

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your storage account.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your storage account.

trans-unit.source: After the VM runs about 5 minutes you should see the four default tables: “LinuxCpu”, ”LinuxDisk”, ”LinuxMemory”, and ”Linuxsyslog”.
trans-unit.target: After the VM runs about 5 minutes you should see the four default tables: “LinuxCpu”, ”LinuxDisk”, ”LinuxMemory”, and ”Linuxsyslog”.

trans-unit.source: Double click the table name to view the data.
trans-unit.target: Double click the table name to view the data.

trans-unit.source: Use <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title>Azure Storage Explorer</title> to access the data.
trans-unit.target: Use <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title>Azure Storage Explorer</title> to access the data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If have enabled fileCfg or perfCfg specified in Scenario 2 and 3, you can use the previous tools to view non-default data.
trans-unit.target: If have enabled fileCfg or perfCfg specified in Scenario 2 and 3, you can use the previous tools to view non-default data.

trans-unit.source: For version 2.0, the Rsyslog information and customer specified log file can only be accessed via scripting.
trans-unit.target: For version 2.0, the Rsyslog information and customer specified log file can only be accessed via scripting.

trans-unit.source: For version 2.0, if you have enabled the Linux Diagnostic extension via script first, then you cannot view the data from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: For version 2.0, if you have enabled the Linux Diagnostic extension via script first, then you cannot view the data from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: If you enable the extension from the portal first, then the scripts will still work.
trans-unit.target: If you enable the extension from the portal first, then the scripts will still work.
